http_https_ingress.responsibility: First receiver for HTTP/HTTPS traffic; routes by hostname/path and reverse_proxies to internal services

mcp-docker.notes: Accessible over VPN as mcp0.idc1.vpn via wg-dns rewrite (*.idc1.vpn -> idc1.vpn) + wg-easy forwarding of MCP_DOCKER_PORT to host gateway

wg-easy.notes: Applies idc1.vpn:22 -> host sshd forwarding via WG_POST_UP in stacks/idc1-stack/docker-compose.yml

wg-dns.notes: CoreDNS for VPN; shares wg-easy netns (network_mode=container:idc1-wg-easy) so it can bind/listen on 10.8.0.1:53 inside the VPN

http_https.notes: Host Caddy should own :80/:443 and forward to per-stack internal Caddy on high ports (e.g. pc1-stack -> 3080/3443).
Host Caddy should own :80/:443 and forward to per-stack internal Caddy on high ports (pc2-worker dev-proxy -> 19081 for HTTP; 3100 remains compatibility for HTTPS).

host_caddy.role: Binds host :80/:443 on pc2 and routes 1mcp.pc2.vpn to the pc2-worker dev-proxy upstream (host.docker.internal:19081).

pc2_worker_dev_proxy.role: Stack-level ingress (published as 19081:80, 3100:443). Terminates/routes stack vhosts (including 1mcp.pc2.vpn) and forwards to the appropriate backend (notably 1mcp-agent on :3050 for MCP aggregation).
